Salami Promises Ivoriens Hell Salami Promises Ivoriens Hell

Golden Eaglets' sweat merchant, coach Ganiyu Salami, has vowed to let his boys loose onthe Ivorien team in the return leg match com- ing up next week. Coach Salami, in a chat with PMsport, yesterday said the first legmatch in Abidjan taught him many things in football. "We'll do our home work properly to ensure good bashing of the Ivorien team in the secondleg. I have a good team, but all the same, we still have one or two things to instil into them before other matches. my mind is set toward winning the first Under-17 Nations Cup. Then, I can face the world. I pray to God that we retain the Under-17 World Cup won in Japan last year," coach Salami said. The hard working coach said with the present crop of players in hisfold, he's ready to take on any team either in Africa or in the whole world. The proprietorofVigilante In- surance Professional (VIP) Foot- ball Club has reaffirmed that the club's chief coach Kafaru Alabi is still with the team. Chief Teluwo who spoke to PMsport yesterday said that the former Lobi bank coach has not inti- mated the management of his desire to leave the club. According to Chief Teluwo, the club would not do anything to hinder the movement of the coach whenever he desires to leave, add- ing that the club operates an open- door policy which allows free entry and exit. "Our's is a humble club which - The proprietorofVigilante In- surance Professional (VIP) Foot- ball Club has reaffirmed that the club's chief coach Kafaru Alabi is still with the team. Chief Teluwo who spoke to PMsport yesterday said that the former Lobi bank coach has not inti- mated the management of his desire to leave the club. According to Chief Teluwo, the club would not do anything to hinder the movement of the coach whenever he desires to leave, add- ing that the club operates an open- door policy which allows free entry and exit. body. Our players can attest to this fact. Any one who wants to go will be allowed to do so," he said. On the issue of the club's team manager Yomi Peters who has re- portedly absconded, the VIP chair man explained that the coach was not sacked but fled the club as a result of his wrong practices. He said he does not want to trade words with him on the pages of newspapers. "I would rather leave everything to God. "Every individual on earth would be judged by his acts so I leave everything to God to judge accordingly," the proprietor said.- - Adeola Fashola body. Our players can attest to this fact.
